name: Curare woorari
Relationship: Compare: CYSTISIN (motor paralysis); CONIUM; CAUSTICUM; CROTALUS; NUX. Curare antidotes STRYCHNIN.

Eyes: Sharp, stitching pains over right eye
Respiratory: Short dry cough; provokes vomiting, followed by fainting
Threatened paralysis of respiration on falling asleep
Modalities: Worse: cold wind; two am; right side
Mind: Indecision; no longer wishes to think, or act for herself
Head: Head drawn backward
Lancinating pains all over head
Brain feels full of fluid
Falling out of hair
Face: Tongue and mouth drawn to right
Nose: Tubercles on nose; fetid lumps of pus
Female: Menses too early, during menses, colic, headache, kidney pain
Extremities: Weakness of hands and fingers in pianists
Tired pain up and down spine
Legs tremble; give way in walking
Ears: Lancinating pains start from ears; extending down to legs

details: Muscular paralysis without impairing sensation and consciousness. Paralysis of respiratory muscles. REFLEX ACTION DIMINISHED. Debility of the aged (BARYTA) and from loss of fluids. Catalepsy. Nervous debility. Trismus. Glycosuria with motor paralysis. Curare decreases the output of adrenaline. Vomiting of bile in cirrhosis of liver. Diabetes mellitus, 4th dilution (Dr. Bark hard).
